availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Selena Dunkeson Woodruff in Christian County, Kentucky, on October 15, 1835. Father of Elizabeth J. Woodruff, Artemissa Woodruff, Nancy A. Woodruff, William J. Woodruff, and Misseuiah J. Woodruff. Married to Mary Woodruff. Blacksmith in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Samuel W. Keyper and William A. S. Wells as blacksmiths in Caldwell County in 1850. Blacksmith in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 344A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 111.
"Dinsmore Woodruff (1815-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #40968211, accessed April 6, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40968211.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465562, p. 131.
